name: Calculus I
description: This course covers limit, continuity, differentiation, and integration of algebraic, exponential, and logarithmic functions of one variable.

name: Physics I
description: This course covers classical mechanics, including kinematics, Newton's laws of motion, work and energy, conservation laws, and rotational motion.

name: Introduction to Engineering Design
description: This course introduces students to the engineering design process, including problem formulation, visualization, optimization, teamwork, and communication.

name: Engineering Graphics
description: This course covers the principles of engineering graphics, including orthographic projection, dimensioning, sectioning, and assembly drawings.

name: Calculus II
description: This course covers techniques and applications of integration, series, and sequences.

name: Physics II
description: This course covers electricity, magnetism, optics, and thermodynamics.

name: Materials Science and Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the structure, properties, and processing of materials, including metals, ceramics, polymers, and composites.

name: Engineering Mechanics: Statics
description: This course covers the principles of engineering mechanics, including particle and rigid body equilibrium, distributed forces, and friction.

name: Introduction to Thermodynamics
description: This course covers the principles of thermodynamics and their applications, including energy, entropy, temperature, and heat transfer.

name: Engineering Mechanics: Dynamics
description: This course covers the principles of engineering mechanics, including kinematics, kinetics, work and energy, impulse and momentum, and vibrations.

name: Probability and Statistics for Engineers
description: This course covers probability theory, random variables, probability distributions, statistical inference, and experimental design.

name: Design of Machine Elements
description: This course covers the design of mechanical components and systems, including stress, strain, deflection, fatigue, and failure analysis.

name: Manufacturing Processes
description: This course covers the principles of manufacturing processes, including casting, forming, cutting, welding, and surface treatment.

name: Operations Research I
description: This course covers the principles of operations research, including linear programming, integer programming, network analysis, and game theory.

name: Engineering Economy
description: This course covers the principles of engineering economy, including time value of money, cost analysis, and project evaluation.

name: Human Factors Engineering
description: This course covers the principles of human factors engineering, including human-machine interaction, ergonomics, and anthropometry.

name: Operations Research II
description: This course covers advanced topics in operations research, including nonlinear programming, dynamic programming, and stochastic processes.

name: Quality Engineering
description: This course covers the principles of quality engineering, including statistical process control, reliability, and acceptance sampling.

name: Simulation Modeling and Analysis
description: This course covers the principles of simulation modeling and analysis, including input modeling, output analysis, and optimization.

name: Industrial Engineering Design
description: This course covers the principles of industrial engineering design, including systems analysis, facility layout, and production planning.
